ghost

Class Waka

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.Waka
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Character

    public class Waka
extends java.lang.Object
implements Character

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Waka(processing.core.PImage leftImage, processing.core.PImage rightImage, processing.core.PImage downImage, processing.core.PImage upImage, processing.core.PImage closeImage)
      Store waka intial position, waka x/y pixels, all image of waka in different direction, waka current image, waka lives, frameRate, fruit eaten by waka, boolean when superfruit being eaten, waka speed, waka x/y coordinate, direction of waka ,future direction of waka and boolean when soda being drank.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Waka

        public Waka(processing.core.PImage leftImage,
            processing.core.PImage rightImage,
            processing.core.PImage downImage,
            processing.core.PImage upImage,
            processing.core.PImage closeImage)
        Store waka intial position, waka x/y pixels, all image of waka in different direction, waka current image, waka lives, frameRate, fruit eaten by waka, boolean when superfruit being eaten, waka speed, waka x/y coordinate, direction of waka ,future direction of waka and boolean when soda being drank.
        Parameters:
        leftImage - Image of waka facing left.
        rightImage - Image of waka facing right.
        upImage - Image of waka facing up.
        downImage - Image of waka facing down.
        closeImage - Image of waka close mouth.

        Take JsonParser Object which created by reading the .JSON file. From the JsonParser Object get speed of waka and waka lives.

      • pixelCheck

        public boolean pixelCheck()
        Return true if xPixels and yPixels is equal to zero.

        Return false if xPixels and yPixels is not equal to zero.

        Specified by:
        pixelCheck in interface Character
        Returns:
        true if equal otherwise false.

      • setWakaPosition

        public void setWakaPosition(Map map)
        Set waka initial position by finding 'p' symbol in the char[][].

        This starting position stored in instance variable labelled startX and startY. This allow us to access them, when waka collide with the ghost.

        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and contain initial coordinates of movable object.

      • setGraphic

        public void setGraphic()
        This method set different graphic based on waka direction and waka frame rate.

        To make the open-close graphic for waka, this method alternate between the open waka and close waka every 8 second.

        Specified by:
        setGraphic in interface Character

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset waka, when waka collide with a normal mode ghost.

        Reset waka : Xcoordinate/tile to 0, Ycoordinate/tile to 0, waka direction to "Left", framerate to 0,

        futureDirection to null, xPixel to 0, yPixel to 0, decrease waka live by 1.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface Character

      • tick

        public void tick(Map map)
        This method check the next tile, whether if its a solid or not. If its not a solid the waka is allowed to add/subtract its xPixels/yPixels (based on waka direction).

        If xPixels/yPixels have reach 16 ,it reset back the pixels to 0 and add/subtract Xcoordinate/Ycoordinate of waka by speed of waka (based on waka direction).

        If waka has reach 8 or -8 pixels check whether the tile is a fruit or not, if it is a fruit add waka fruiteaten by 1 and change tile to empty object. If the fruit eaten by waka is a superfruit , change isSuper variable to true. If soda drank by waka , change isSoda variable to true. Check if waka have future movement and set waka graphic.

        Specified by:
        tick in interface Character
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft(Map map)
        The method check if left tile from waka is solid or not, if left tile is not a solid waka can turn, but this happen only if the both pixels has turn to zero. If the condition required is not fulfilled the move inputed is stored in future direction.
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(Map map)
        The method check if right tile from waka is solid or not, if right tile is not a solid waka can turn, but this happen only if the both pixels has turn to zero. If the condition required is not fulfilled the move inputed is stored in future direction.
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(Map map)
        The method check if Up tile from waka is solid or not, if Up tile is not a solid waka can turn, but this happen only if the both pixels has turn to zero. If the condition required is not fulfilled the move inputed is stored in future direction.
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(Map map)
        The method check if Down tile from waka is solid or not, if Down tile is not a solid waka can turn, but this happen only if the both pixels has turn to zero. If the condition required is not fulfilled the move inputed is stored in future direction.
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • checkNextMove

        public void checkNextMove(Map map)
        This method check whether future direction can be applied to current direction. Waka only allowed to change direction if the next tile (based on direction) is not a solid and pixels are zero.

        Reset future direction back to null, if future direction successfully applied.

        Specified by:
        checkNextMove in interface Character
        Parameters:
        map - Object where walls and fruit being placed, stored and use as background for the waka.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Draw waka in correct position, for X axis : Xcoordinate * 16 add by their Xpixels subtract offset, for Y axis : Ycoordinate * 16 add by Ypixels subtract offset.

        Draw waka lives at the bottom of the map.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface Character
        Parameters:
        app - PApplet object.
